title: failed when compiling from from "@truffle/contract"
body:
- [ ] I've [opened a support ticket](https://trufflesuite.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue
I'm trying to fetch json file and transform them into an object so that I can interact, while using the importing from "@truffle/contract"  and when I run npm start, the compile run out the time. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82292554/170818181-5a014c32-44ec-484e-9ae4-1c8cdbbb8982.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82292554/170818226-24d98b1f-287b-4b77-90a5-907489310cff.png)


### the terminal message

```

Starting the development server...
Starting the development server...
Starting the development server...
Starting the development server...
Starting the development server...

info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```

@Afrahdev interesting! Looks like the node process is running out of memory. Is the JSON file very large (maybe gigabytes in size)? My hunch is that it is not Truffle Contract that is the problem, as that appears to be on the front-end (in the browser) and it is the react development server that is crashing for some reason; it's hard to say what is going wrong given the information provide. Can you provide reproduction steps?
Did you find a solution to this? I just ran into this issue myself.

> Did you find a solution to this? I just ran into this issue myself.

Not really I think the reason is the package is too big run and it takes a while that time. The only way I can think of is by increasing the usage memory up to 8gb on node
@mmichaud93 @Afrahdev We never received reproduction steps on this; do either of you have any more information you can provide on the issue so that we can work to get it fixed? Thank you!
Hey @mmichaud93, @Afrahdev - I'm closing this for issue maintenance. Please comment if you have any information to share, and we'll reopen.
